DOC.brief_summary: The STIM-EHPAD study (for stimulation in nursing home) aims to evaluate the short and medium term effectiveness of staff education as a non-pharmacological intervention to manage apathy in older people with a diagnosis of dementia. - Primary efficacy criteria: Apathy Inventory clinician score changes - Secondary efficacy criteria: Apathy Inventory patient and caregiver version changes, Observation scale changes, frequency and severity of the other BPSD using the NPI, qualitative analysis of the nursing home staff behavioural changes
DOC.brief_title: Non Pharmacological Treatment in Alzheimer's Disease and Associated Disorders
